parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To declare openly, proclaim, preach, laud, celebrate. From kata and the base of aggelos; to proclaim, promulgate.
A custom, habit; an institute, rite. From etho; a usage.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Roman; subst: a Roman citizen. From Rhome; Romaean, i.e. Roman.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To receive, accept, acknowledge. From para and dechomai; to accept near, i.e. Admit or delight in.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
